channel.title: News on inNative WebAssembly Runtime
channel.description: Recent content in News on inNative WebAssembly Runtime

item.title: Introducing inNative
item.description: Many people are excited about WebAssembly, which lets you use languages other than JavaScript on the web. With WebAssembly, you can run C, C++, Rust, Zig, Go, or pretty much anything that compiles to LLVM in a sandbox running inside your web browser. This has performance costs, but many people are working on highly optimized JIT compilers designed to minimize these costs as much as possible. I’m not interested in that.
